F7YxN1lt5GnPvHgCXxj2tw.text: I went for a meal here after hearing good reviews of another branch in Cambridge. I have to say it was pretty disappointing. We were ignored on arrival by no less than 6 members of staff and then asked to wait when someone finally did come and speak to us, despite the fact that the place was mostly empty. When he did return he took us to a table, practically grunted and left. Then things picked up somewhat as the waitress who took over was delightful - very helpful and attentive, despite being busy - and we were given menus straight away. The dining experience itself could have been better - the food was fairly expensive for the quality and some things were just plain wrong (I wouldn't advise the hollandaise sauce to anyone). Also, as the ceilings are high and the windows are huge, it's all very noisy and really quite cold. It felt a bit like a pub trying to be a restaurant, if you know what I mean.

E40SV-GBFYag0m9nY1L_Og.text: Had tea here with my niece during the book festival, sat outside in the sunshine and had a lovely meal, good service and watched the world go by. Price was reasonable and we really enjoyed ourselves.

VwtYrRSR6OuW8Fbda3er3g.text: What's happened here? This used to be my absolute fave restaurant. Great atmosphere, beatutiful rooms, great food, a really nice Scottish waitress who would conscientiously tell you about the daily specials in a charming way. Weeellll the lovely waitress has gone (where?oh where?) replaced by male staff totally in love with themselves, and not at all interested in seating or serving guests ,the atmosphere is not so great any more (at least in my opinion) but the food. Now this is where I really been having problems lately. The cheeseburger used to be an absolutely reliable staple -last time I went I could hardly eat a quarter of it Never mind the half raw onion thoughtfully placed next to it, it was the meat that really shocked me. I thought maybe better not eat any more, you never know. My partner's salmon was flavourless. Another time we went a side dish of green beans had definitely not seen any boiling water, let alone seasoning. So what is going on here? Cost cutting? A new chef? I have no idea. Come back, old Brown's, I beg you!

qqs1WUqMmpFGZM6PBiX5vw.text: Good food, decent sized portions and relatively good prices for George Street. Nicely furnished and, unlike other establishments, the service charge here is optional. One thing to know if you're planning a meal here in advance: you can't reserve a table, so be warned. In spite of this I've never had a long wait for a table here. They have a wide selection of food and drink, their afternoon tea is delicious. Definitely worth a visit :)

jnKJJBNrar5CGdQW59OGAQ.text: I am always disappointed with Browns - it promises so much and I really don't believe that it delivers. It's near my old office so have been here for some girlie meals after work and for some business lunches with colleagues.   In both cases I always am left thinking that they don't get it right. It's not cheap and the menu always looks good with interesting dishes but they seem to make them very bland in the execution.   The service is always a bit half hearted as well - I have felt in past that I was an inconvenience to them because I wasn't ready to order in 2 mins flat.   I have now given up on it - I sometimes walk past and think I will try again cos it looks so lovely but have resisted the temptation so far!

1vZUUem6xWJHt6m-Dlqr6g.text: I went here with my work for a 'work night out' a few years ago. The food was really good, probably one of the best meals I have ever had. There is a good selection on the menu with something for everyone. The drinks here are very good also, nice cocktails.  It is quite expensive to eat here, and the drinks can be quite expensive too depending on what you buy. The biggest problem for me is that you can't book, you just have to go along and hope for the best, they have you sit in the bar while you wait for a seat. Guess it's a good way of making them more money but a bit annoying if you were looking for a special night out

LpUqBPKL8OAhybjR_KpUdw.text: Came here for breakfast so can only rate it on that. I had what i rate the best eggs florentine in edinburgh and some extremely tasty sausages on the side. Will definitely revisit for breakfast as the service was also fast and friendly.

CXb713JE3fHouBE-xpMT3w.text: Had a festive dinner. Beef Wellington was fantastic.

oDQ0R8upEaP2FSSaO7xSeQ.text: Just Arrived, so far so good! Not a bad evening in the end, food reasonable and service was good

ATuajCiyN7K4de_IVK4vAg.text: Visited here for breakfast, and we were suitably impressed. I had ham and eggs, and a friend had Eggs Benedict. The atmosphere was maybe a little quiet and high-brow for a breakfast setting, but its a friendly and welcoming place. Didn't want to talk too loud though! Would definitely recommend it as a breakfast venue if you're in the area (don't be put off by the lack of a breakfast menu outside - they have a decent selection!)

LuzVd92xRLC-ChRN33cZ4w.text: Nice place for sunday brunch. Wait staff is a hit and miss. Some do give you good service but the rest are not that interested as long as they deliver you your order. Tables are a bit too close to each other. The coffee is great.

w9InL_tx32CEEvjJ-3MKRQ.text: I'm a big fan of Browns after being treated to a birthday breakfast here. The decor was neutral but trendy and the service was efficient. The staff took themselves a bit too seriously, but it gave the place a bit of a pompus air which I'll admit, I kinda enjoyed; Browns reminded me of a cosmopolitan New York bistro. The best bit though? Their Eggs Florentine. I'm already planning my next visit. Yum.

dXIs-KK0SaSKkuQRob7xxQ.text: Really, really like coming here for a few drinks. Excellent atmosphere helped in part by the South African-esq decor. Awseome range of draught beers and ciders, interspersed with some pretty badass cocktails make Browns a 'total' winner. 4 badger stars from me!

3l4ZAjqgfx6mBZT_G6dkog.text: The only reason i remember this restaurant was because the food took ages to arrive, and wasnt that great when it did. The restaurant was pretty empty and lacked atmosphere. The waiter however was great, very attentive and genuine. This was back in February 2009 and reading the other reviews its possible it was just that i was unlucky.

owqwH5QANba4Ft3TlBfw-g.text: Although I really really like the food at Browns it has to be said it is a little pricey for what you get. So I would say its definately for more special occasions than a random Wednesday night when you cant be bothered to cook! The place itself is great for evenings in the summer though as the windows open right out and you can enjoy the cool breeze. I know an opportunity for this is few and far between because of our great Scottish weather! But at least you know where to run to if we get a suprise turn about in the weather.

VF4y5QBSG14W0u7xV7afhg.text: The food is always pretty good in here. We really like the breakfast, although not too keen on the beef tomato, too big for me. Always really clean and nice and relaxing! never been at night but will give it a try soon.

gyniyWXOjzYYMUnhSD9dvw.text: I have been to Browns three times now and every time as been fantastic. Great value for money, food has been 5* and service also up there! Last time we went we had a table of 15 people and the service was again, very good! Would definately recommend it

F1BlDrXtqoeone8YTeAbVw.text: Been there a couple of times now and the food is excellent and reasonably priced. If the service had been a little bit quicker it would be worth 5 stars, however the waiter (an Aussie) kept us informed what was happening. A three course meal with a couple of drinks thrown in was 60, which for Edinburgh is good value. The portions were good and the quality was 1st class well worht a visit if youre in the vicinity

NBztwahwCjZZSyl2RYZkMg.text: Brown's in Edinburgh - like the other branches of this UK chain - is, for me, an easy choice for a last minute lunch or early evening meal. Why do I say that - well you don't need to book in advance - the place is so cavernous that I have always been able to get a table. Despite some of the previous comments I have always found the staff to be efficient, friendly and helpful. The food will never win any foodie stars or medals but it is dependable, well executed and tasty. My particular favourite is the fish and chips with minty, mushy peas. It occurs to me also that they must be doing something right - the first time I came across them was in 1978 in Oxford. One thing, important to me at least, that is worth a mention is that they have a good selection of premium gins - key to starting a good meal off well.

-MPWnjJoJEPnfNssgsX42g.text: We never miss visiting Browns when we're in Edinburgh. The atmosphere is always fab-whether for a long lazy, brunch on a Sunday ( Eggs Benedict a must!) or for lunch or dinner. Food is bistro style and always reliable and good -and plenty of it. There's a good range of beers and wines-try the local Innis and Gunn ale-and staff are always friendly. It's got a lovely busy buzz that we like lots. And being in the centre of Ed's best shopping area it's a perfect place to down bags after a spree.

MvggzpRDIIj_n08RjjwCsQ.text: Browns is fine for the occasional lunch, or stopping in for coffee and scone after a hard days shopping! I think it is reasonably priced for a George Street establishment, with a standard menu and bland atmosphere. The decor is dated and it's a bit stuffy really. The service for me is half-hearted, and not at all warm or friendly.   The food is decent but nothing special, I can't even recall a time I've been here where I've thought 'wow, I enjoyed that' - it's just ok.

0U0gspeK8nZCoBeMZlEdPg.text: This is a restaurant/bar at the western end of Edinburgh's prestigious George Street. If you are looking for a more classy establishment where there is very little chance of coming into contact with someone wearing a tracksuit then this is the place for you. The drinking/sitting area as you go in is not huge. Everyone gets a seat. There is none of the getting shoved and nudged by people walking past. For George Street, which is generally expensive I have always found Browns to be reasonably priced by comparison.   Overall I would reccomend this place to anyone wishing a superior evening experience.

nvmfRVG_vt8EfSnJQaHUIQ.text: Although I've never eaten in here, I love coming into Brown's for after work drinks. It is such a relaxing place, with polite, courteous staff and more often than not lovely background piano music. The best thing about Brown's though, is the delicious special offer they have on fantastic cocktails during the week - I can highly recommend them!

8o8Dn2I2D9i11l0_eB3szg.text: I've been to Brown's 3 or 4 times recently for drinks and I've also eaten there. I quite like this place. It's located on Edinburgh's George Street which is full of places similar to this. The drink selection is great although prices are a bit on the steep side  although that is pretty standard for George Street. I've heard good reviews about the food from friends and family however the last time I ate there my meal was burnt at the bottom and cold in the middle. I think I must have been unlucky though due to the other good feedback I've heard.

Vbw7joxA748DsE8f4ovR8Q.text: We had dinner with "the ladies" as Randy called them or ya ya's as they called themselves -- I had spent the day with them after seeing the Castle and had a wonderful time picking out gifts for everyone.  We ended up here and Randy met us.  I had the burger, which I inhaled and a Sazerac -- most places don't know how to make that drink.   I had introduced the ladies to the benefits of hard apple cider at a pub earlier on Rose St and many of them had cider with their burgers.   We had excellent service and we got to eat outside Ina covered tent next to the most fragrant Rosemary plant.   It was a great dinner with great company and I think I love love Scotland.

df4KwM7OX_cFeKs6MOGesg.text: to start, this review is based purely on my consumption of cocktail delights!!  however the first cold friday in december saw me and my work team headed for our xmas lunch and night out.  being the awesome people we are the decision was made to leave the office early and head to brown's for some of their awesome cocktails!  and awesome they were!  first off they have a HUGE list to choose from!  and it's not just your classic combinations (which you can also get), but champange cocktails and signature cocktails and autograph cocktails oh my!  having a quick read of the menu at work i immeditaly decided on a pretty in pink!  for two reasons, it had prosecco and it was named after my favourite colour.  perhaps a silly reason to choose a drink but this was certainly an excellent choice.  the cocktail was bubbly from the prosecco, sweet from the sugar cube, and had a wee kick from the orange vodka!  i'd definitely recommend it!  i also had a sip of the rivoting rasberry which was very good as well.  sadly we only had time for  two drinks before heading off to dinner, but i noticed that they offer their cocktails for 5 from wednesday to sunday so i think i will definitely be back to sample some more!

photos.caption: Photo of Browns- Edinburgh - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Pretty in pink cocktail

r99DYswEcQl-8I5xfwJyVQ.text: Very disppointed!!!  On a sunny Tuesday afternoon my lady and I were in need of wine and nibbles. We thought Browns would be nice so sat and awaited service. 10 minutes past and nobody came so I popped in grabbed menus and the waitress said she would be along in a few minutes. 10 minutes passed....still no service.  So we went to Tigerlilly and had a fantastic afternoon! Wont be back anytime soon, Edinburgh has too many places for them to get away with service like that!  ADDITION: credit to Browns - I passed on my feedback and they have invited me to come back and try again on them!

PbgXAxUC84e-tRaZRBOpSw.text: A nice experience.   Starters were pretty good, everybody's mains were very well received (particularly the pheasant) but deserts were reported as ranging from excellent through to unexciting. The cookies & cream cheesecake wasn't enjoyed - hot choc brownies were universally appreciated.   Waitress was excellent & coped cheerily with the chaos, of our ordering.   We were a party of 15 but even allowing for that, food wasn't quick enough to arrive.   Overall; good & enjoyable.   Most had just two courses & not much alcohol was quaffed. Came to 37/head.   We will return at some point.

photos.caption: Photo of Browns- Edinburgh - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

YVl6NZa9nT9rSWymh-Eqxg.text: I like Brown's. Now I love little independent restaurants, but as a chain, Brown's delivers time and time again.  My love affair with Brown's started in Covent Garden a few good years ago. Great food, great surroundings and reasonably priced too but not available north of the border :-(   The Covent Garden place seems to show off their default business model and when I arrived in Edinburgh, it was the first restaurant I took visitors to.  I've been for food a good few times and service and quality is consistent. Sign up to friends of Brown's and you can get sent various, great value deals.   This weekend it was for drinks only. A new work colleague was visiting Edinburgh for a few days and we decided to meet for a drink so I could give him the lowdown on Edinburgh living. It was pouring of rain but we decided to meet in George Street.  Then I started to panic. Yep, Scottish weather is horrific and it was bouncing off the streets. And its graduation ball weekend so bars would be full of pissed, glammed up students (maybe some of mine). Where was going to be great for having a couple of drinks, a chat and in civilised surroundings? Brown's was my saviour. I knew the new colleague was a man who liked his ale (CAMRA membership) and the Caley 80 on tap at Brown's would fit the bill.   We had a great chat and Brown's was good. Yep, it was busy but we got a table easy enough. Bar service was efficient and we weren't being hassled to leave or keep ordering more drinks so a pleasant drink turned into being there till closing time.

7SZGgraqsNGq6g90KMI3Jg.text: During my only visit to Brown's, one memory sticks out above all others.  A 50 year old woman, in fishnets, taking a photo of all the empty martini glasses that she and her cackling coven had guzzled their way through on a Wednesday afternoon.  This perhaps tainted what seems to be a good if not amazing venue, which can't seem to work out if it's a style bar, a wine bar, a traditional bar, or a restaurant.  This jack of all trades ethos isn't necessarily a bad thing though, as amongst much of the skankhuts on George Street it does have a nice, if slightly processed feel that makes it seem formal yet casual at the same time, and a suitable venue for both a fancy cocktail and a cheese ploughmans.  On that note, I've never eaten here, but did like the look of the menu. Chances are I'll go back one day.

photos.caption: Photo of Browns- Edinburgh - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. from website
Photo of Browns- Edinburgh - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. from website
Photo of Browns- Edinburgh - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. from website

Ghak_VjoJfJCETtWMqVjEA.text: Great lobster tagliatelle and they have an offer on cocktails: Cosmo and berry martini are great at 5 only! Really good location on George street too.

photos.caption: Photo of Browns- Edinburgh - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

765ZI9AMXry_D3pnI4-Hog.text: If there's one thing I can say about Browns it is this - reliable. It was one of the few places on George Street that didn't take reservations (although it has just started to) so you can walk in whenever you like and get a table. I recently came here after a long drive, at 9.30pm thinking the kitchen would be closed (as it was a Tuesday night) but I was greeted with great enthusiasm and invited to look at the menu within minutes of arriving. I asked for the fish of the day - a fish pie, which was delicious. I was even given a poached egg following a conversation with the waiter - it's the small things! The fish pie came with tempura prawns as the chef decided he wanted to play around with the dish, which I loved.  Their cocktails are really nice too, a bit pricey, but good. Their menu is really extensive and they do a brilliant brunch which I highly recommend. Again, there can only be one word for Browns - reliable.

photos.caption: Photo of Browns- Edinburgh - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Taken from website

gEmTtLfCtNIHlsGdn1NOQg.text: This is another restaurant my lovely Grandmother has treated me to lunch at.  The location on George Street is the first indication it will be a little expensive. But unlike a lot of the overly trendy bars and restaurants on George Street, Browns is actually worth it. The decor is charming, its very light and charming. The staff are attentive and well trained.   The menu ranges from salads to steaks, but most dishes are very interesting and the descriptions make your mouth water. It took us both a long time to decide. I went for the Chargrilled Chicken Salad  which was complimented nicely with pear and pine nuts. It was fresh and delicious. There is also a great cocktail menu, but we didn't try any.  I would probably return here on a special occasion as it is quite expensive. However there is usually some great deals available from their website.

photos.caption: Photo of Browns- Edinburgh - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

HgXl_W-42fEAg2T6IOGNbg.text: There's something very comfy about eating at Browns; it isn't too clink clink, but has the service and attention to detail that makes it welcoming no matter whether you're in with a date or work colleagues for lunch.    Don't miss deserts, especially the crepes and if you can't get a table right away, have a drink at the bustling wee bar.

mF2KG_VRTyUVNn1Tiz26_Q.text: I was in Edinburgh on business and found this establishment very pleasant and comfortable. The skylights give it a nice 'tearoom' feel to it, but it IS half bar and half restaurant.  I was the mid Saturday afternoon and just had a bar snack.  There is a kind of tapas option in the bar snacks section, and there was a three for two offer on that. Buttered King Prawns, crab on Ciabatta  and chicken and chorizo skewers were all delicious and filling.   There was a jazz trio playing some live instrumental music which gave the place an even nicer ambience to it. Overall the drink selection, and the tasty food, were not too expensive in comparison to city centre prices.  I'd recommend a visit to this pub and will visit it again should ever get the chance to come back.

F7m66V0H4TRgpQO-UDOXHA.text: My friends and I had breakfast at Browns during a summer holiday in Edinburgh. It's a lovely looking restaurant with traditional looking furniture and a vibrant atmosphere.   The food, although not cheap, was all excellent and we wished we had had time to breakfast there again, but we were leaving that day.   Situated on George street, the restaurant is very central, thus easy to get to, if you're staying in the city.   My only disappointment was with the staff. They appeared uninterested in their customers and appeared to forget what we had ordered a few times.

photos.caption: Photo of Browns- Edinburgh - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

8GOIMJ1WMPQf5hx4yBrROA.text: Went to Browns for a late lunch today (a Saturday). At 2:30pm, I couldn't believe how busy it was - the restaurant was almost completely full!  There was a mixture of families, couples and even a hen's do. It is a lovely setting with natural light coming in from the ceiling windows and lots of greenery.  It was rather noisy though. I liked the look of the menu, a little bit fine dining, with a few classics as well.  However, for the price, I was rather disappointed with my main of sea bass fillet with sweet potato, roasted courgettes, red onion and black olive dressing for 10.  The waiter had informed that this was a small meal, so if I was really hungry to order a side too.  So, I also ordered some green beans, which were literally just a pot of steamed green beans with no dressing or anything, yet still cost 2.50! All of my vegetables were underdone and the fish was just average.  It still tasted nice, but I feel like I could have cooked the dish better myself.  My friend had fish and chunky hand cut chips, which I'm told was nice, but a bit steep at 12.50 and likewise with the drinks.  I liked the setting, so would possibly go back for drinks, but not for food.

0ZPn3jpZcIBhJxucl0tCXg.text: i have been here around 3 times now and for the first 2 it was lovely, although pricy! it used to have a very very nice cheese and tomato flatbread,and the main reason we came back was for that! unfortunately, they don't do this anymore which was really disappointing.   however, for the first 2 times we went there the food was icredible and cooked just right. however, last time i went it was not too good. the waiter was obviously a trainee and did not know what he was doing. we waited a very long time for our food and when it finally got to us it was cold. we asked the waiter if he could heat it up for us, and after yetr another wait, he brung it back cold again. so again, we asked him to heat it up and finally it was warm. the food was okay, but for what it was Very overpriced.   browns is very clean and classy, but i wouldn't recommend going.

v3AfW9ZK8KlAh3nhYNpzvg.text: My company decided to reward us hard workers with a night on the town, and they picked Browns as the restaurant for dinner.  I'd never been but was super excited- drinks and meal that I don't have to pay for sweet!  How can you go wrong?!  And I absolutely hate having to say that I really wish they had chosen somewhere else.    I've never been to Browns before but the interior is beautiful.  Very classy.  The cocktails and drinks we had were amazing- absolutely perfect.  I ordered the vodka martini and it was perfect.  THE perfect martini.  Everyone else in my group were really happy with their drinks as well.  And then the food arrived, and that's when things went downhill.  We started with the sharing platter and it was just a bunch of food thrown on a plate.  It didn't look appealing or tasty, it was just there.  I've had better.  For the mains we ordered duck, lobster, steak, and salmon (hey we weren't paying, and isn't the saying go big or go home).  The duck was extremely fatty and covered in layers of grease.  Now duck is usually fatty, but the amount of grease on this plate was out of control.  The lobster tail was small and covered in so much butter you could barely taste the natural flavours.  My coworker who ordered the salmon couldn't even eat it, she said it was so terrible.  And my boss had the steak.  She ordered it medium and it came out blood rare.  The server took it back to get it cooked up; it came back 30 minutes (30 minutes!!) later burned to a crisp.  It was really disappointing.    I always try places twice if I didn't like it the first time, so I'll go back for the food again.  And I'll definitely go back for cocktails, because they really were fantastic (also apparently they do drink deals at certain times).  The service was fantastic, I have to say.  But for everything that was right during our evening, it was just disappointing that the food was so wrong.

3iBWEs5oQQz_1yY3BvcJ5g.text: Whether you're looking for a few cocktails, afternoon tea or a full three-course meal, Browns is definitely among the best that George Street has to offer.  We went for the early evening Prix Fixe menu, offering us two courses for 12.95, from an extremely attractive and varied menu, with the option to upgrade to 14.95 for those with more premium tastes.  The food was delicious, there was an even spread of meat-based and vegetarian dishes to choose from for both courses. I opted for the Baby Spinach, Avocado and Bacon salad for starter followed by the Monkfish wrapped in Prosciutto for main course (from the 14.95 selection)... I was not disappointed!  Although the cocktails may be a tiny bit on the pricey side, the first-rate service, great food and relaxing yet stylish ambience created by the live pianist made an excellent and highly-recommendable combination for roughly 20-25 a head.  I will be heading back there soon to sample their Brunch and Afternoon Tea menu...

n5qiXK0nyyHPLn56ztZCPA.text: I have only been here fleetingly on a lunch time, so I have to say my knowledge of Browns is limited to a 1.5 hour period around lunchtime, and not the night time dining Browns also does.  I'm pleased to say, that Browns was excellent - its food seemed to be very medditeranian influenced, although there were a few suprises on the menu that I though might have been a bit out of place. The drinks were well priced, but I did get the impression that the food was a little expensive, but I didnt expect it to be cheap saying as we were on George Street.  Browns itself is modern, clean and crisp - with a nice atmosphere, and friendl staff.

BiO0yckiq3-8A_YCY2vATg.text: This restaurant is located in the more upmarket area of Edinburgh and at lunch time primarily has business clientele. My uncle took me here on his recent visit up to Edinburgh. The food is very good, their dishes are mostly Mediterranean inspired. I really liked their risotto I had but the waiter said that they seasonally change their menu.   It's very large inside but I would recommend booking a table for a Friday-weekend night, and is more for a fancy occasion rather than a quick bite. It certainly is a highlight in George Street dining.

jyhHhRN7ofj9vOWV--AT_Q.text: I know some reviewers have found fault with Brown's for various reasons - but it is still one of my favourite places to eat. The steaks are amazing - the wine list really good and full and the deserts lovely. The on-line "friends of Browns" club is really good and gets you a discounted meal and wine for two, as well as access to a special cheaper 2 course menu. I would agree some of the male staff may show more interest in themselves than the customers but what the hell...some of them are quite hot and the food is good - what's not to like!

r6hvTVVo-Dpz8ThnEHBu1w.text: Excellent stop for brunch.  Had the eggs benedict.  Great flavor, executed well.  Looked like everyone was enjoying the food they were turning out in the kitchen.  Good service.

fP5vT0ajj7Oj3YSFpO3jPA.text: We are staying next door at Eden Locke and stopped by Browns for dinner last night. The entrance was festooned with gorgeous blooms which was immediately luring. Apparently, they had just undergone a one-month refurbishment and we had come on reopening night. I must say that the whole restaurant looked beautiful--with plush jewel tone furnishings, mirrors, fresh floral arrangements and brass accents. Very luxe and updated. I have no idea what it looked like before--our waiter told us the restaurant had been around since 1973 so I imagine that the remodel was much needed. We were greeted with flutes of champagne and Scottish smoked salmon canapes. We started with the whole baked Camembert which came to the table hot and bubbling with toasted baguette fingers for dipping. I ordered their famous steak & Guinness pie which looked like it came straight out of a storybook. The pastry top is was a glossy golden brown. The stew inside was delicious. The steak was simmered in Guinness for six hours so it was perfectly tender. It came with a side of buttery mashed potatoes and a rich gravy. Such a comforting meal yet presented so nicely. My companion had the roast pork belly which came with the crackling, a savory apple pie, mash & gravy and green beans. Traditional Scottish meal--totally hit the spot on a drizzly Edinburgh night!

photos.caption: Photo of Browns- Edinburgh - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Steak &amp; Guiness pie

4M5UKtFmaySKKGKQn4Zwpw.text: Outstanding service, totally tasty food, and a very posh looking dining space. We loved it here! So much, that some of us returned multiple times! Brunch is my favorite sport, and Browns showed ya that they are professionals! Perfectly spicy bloody marys, a plethora of Benedict options, and True experts on the full Scottish breakfast- haggis and al! Come ready to eat, you'll love this place just as we did!

5Bjh7t-FguY0czJ7Lr9lfA.text: Went for breakfast as we saw the menu walking around. Food was fantastic. I had lobster eggs Benedict and the eggs came out perfect, not overly runny, and the pieces of grilled lobster tasted better than most lobster places I've been to. My wife had smoked halibut eggs Florentine and while I normally don't like mixing fish with things, the smoked halibut actually set off the eggs. The waiter was attentive but not annoying. Overall the best breakfast I've had in some time.

hsQaJXBcE1soJKgyUEhggw.text: This restaurant is located in picturesque George street. Great service and wonderful food!

Z0Y4_NHc8hV4nssPJbIQ3g.text: This place has been around for ages.  The quality of food has improved over time, thankfully, although I was in for lunch today (linguine) and it was tepid.  Taste was acceptable. What this place has going for it is the extensive brunch menu, varied menu - am pretty sure you could something for everyone on it - and the cocktail list.  They also serve afternoon tea but I've not tried it.

E8keN94WSR5C-Vmq2xyZBw.text: Had the filet.   It was very good!   My wife had the chicken and ham pie and loved it.  Our last night in Edinburgh was topped off with an excellent meal!

LmnA5YY8O-JTdCjiJ0wnqQ.text: My friend suggested going into Browns for a couple of drinks and after she described the cocktails as 'AMAZING' I didn't need much more convincing...  There were plenty of tables available (it's quite a large place) and we found some seats near the bar. The tables were all clean and tidy - the glass collectors do a good job here! It was pretty busy but perfect for sitting having a chat. Music wise I loved it - James Bay and Ed Sheeran over good cocktails. I'm tempted to move in..  The staff do a great job (particularly those working at the bar) and there were a steady flow of customers. They have a really extensive cocktail menu and each of the cocktails I had were well presented and tasted delicious! The staff made the time to chat to you as they were making your drinks and offered to bring them to your table if you were going to be waiting longer than a few minutes (if they had to go get fresh supplies etc).   Glass collectors do a great job too and everywhere was clean and tidy. I've never visited the Browns in Glasgow but after this, I'm tempted! And if it's not as good...it's back to Edinburgh!

photos.caption: Photo of Browns- Edinburgh - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Bar area.
Photo of Browns- Edinburgh - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Cosmo Time!
Photo of Browns- Edinburgh - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Riveting Raspberry!

L7GLVJMJlLnIj81DFazHDA.text: Browns. Edinburgh Tuesday.  7.15 ish pm  I feel so fortunate to know how wonderful this place is. The ambiance and the service second to none. Tremendously aware and polished. Not only the entire restaurant but the service. Eye contact and gentle check ins to see all ok. I've had the crab & king prawn linguine --- beautifully cooked (nice al dente pasta). And had a side of broccoli with hollandaise and Stilton on the side. All with a large class of gorgeous Malbec.   Truly divine.

photos.caption: Photo of Browns- Edinburgh - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. As usually forgot to take a photo!  My food was delish!!!!

4pOAtuJZrGm4z3ylWXZHDQ.text: I experienced my first afternoon teatime with three friends at Browns, and it was lovely. We ordered two teas-for-two, which allows you to choose your own pot of tea and comes with quite the assortment of snacks. There are three kinds of finger sandwiches, a warm scone with clotted cream and jam, a chocolate-covered cream puff, a meringue, and a piece of fruit cake.  The inside is really pretty, with high ceilings and glass for sunlight to come in. It felt very classy, but was affordable. Altogether a great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Browns- Edinburgh - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. tea for four

2mtjsN8ROF9sMgwc_wUrhA.text: I'll say upfront this is a borderline two star review, but it *just* about did enough to push it two three.  Browns is one of those places we seem to have been going to for years, and I'm not entirely sure why; probably just habit. We came here on Mothers day as we were struggling to find places that were child friendly.   On the positive side - it's quite a nice venue. It's large, bright and airy. There was  a piano player twinkling away on some Elton John tunes in the corner.   It was Sunday so we ended up having the roast dinner option. I had pork belly and apple; it wasn't bad but the sharing platter of vegetables were pretty cold and the green beans like rubber. My dessert, a brownie and ice cream, was as you'd expect - but others weren't so lucky with some key components inexplicably missing. The childrens portions were *huge*.  The service staff were friendly; but there were long periods of waiting and they didn't wipe the table after the main course. It also took 3 attempts to get the bill correct.  My Mum did seem to enjoy it though which counts for a lot and most of the food was fine. If it was a quieter day and you ordered something safe from the menu (like a burger), I think Browns would probably be nice enough.

2cD9Nsw1wKfaeSBrmCGJGQ.text: Last Sunday I promised my guest that he needs to try out the traditional full breakfast!   Our first choice was fully booked by 10:20, plus there was a waiting queue, so after some wandering in Rose street where most places would open at 11:00 or 12:00 (not the most typical brunch places, True that), we ended up in Browns!   I really liked the setting inside Browns - we got seated on the right side (up 3-4 stairs), quite open area. There was plenty of space further inside too with roof windows lightening the area, but we couldn't sit there, till the breakfast area was full.   My guest got the full breakfast and he was delighted with it, although he skipped the black pudding, but for his own personal reasons, not that there was something wrong with it.  My partner got the vegetarian breakfast - both breakfast options were accompanied by proper bread, slightly toasted to get the crispy crust. They both enjoyed it (I could tell from the empty dishes!)  I got the eggs royale option: smoked salmon and hollandaise sauce on top of a bagel! Nom, nom!   Their orange juice was not fresh, but that's acceptable from a bar. The coffees were good, but nothing special.   Everything was cooked well, and we got our tummies full!   It was a pleasant surprise also finding out the hidden deal: 2nd breakfast for free!   I think I'll go back for some more in the future! ;-)

photos.caption: Photo of Browns- Edinburgh - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Veggie breakfast
Photo of Browns- Edinburgh - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Traditional breakfast
Photo of Browns- Edinburgh - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Egg royale with smoked salmons

i3kWATo3Li7Bz-gTnGoXJA.text: So I love the eggs benedict here but I think the buck stops there.   I had acquired a voucher for 5 off a main so me and another mama ventured to browns with our toddlers and a baby in tow. It was a good deal cause we both had vouchers which (depending on your main)  could mean lunch for 2 pounds! Not bad!   We both got the chicken and avocado sandwiches (possibly cause we are both Cali girls). The chips are thin and very yummy but the sandwich was a mess and the chicken was dry and hardened at places. Kind of a let down. The seasoning was fine but the actual ingredients didn't seem to work well. The focaccia bread wasn't adequate and broke apart. The sandwich just didn't work for me. I was bummed but not too bummed cause I ended up spending about 3 on lunch, which is quite alright!  If I had paid full price I would have been pissed and not in the drunken sense if you catch my drift ;)  Also, the kids meals/portions are HUGE!!! If you are dining with a toddler or smaller child probably best sharing your meal and adding a veggie side.

kmCVn0huqoIXVTxV6S-6kQ.text: I have been to Browns a handful of times, always wanting to give it another go based on a recommendation and always walking away wondering why I did.  Every time I have been here I have had food which is mediocre at best. It does a job but doesn't exactly do it well.  My most recent visit was no different - everything we ordered turned up greasy and on a bed of mayo. Did we choose poorly?  Definitely. But come on.  The fish cakes were about 95% potato and the sweet potato wedges were enormous slices of sweet potato which must have been boiled first as they were (mostly) cooked through but were soft instead of coming across as baked or fried, albeit covered with a layer of oil.  Very confusing and resulting in not a nice dish.  The chorizo sausage roll was dripping in oil (bad choice on our part but really poor menu choice on Browns part), which left is with only the Cesar salad which was fresh and well dressed.  On top of the food, the service was close to abysmal. Our server brought ice water when I asked for no ice (I know, and by itself it wouldn't matter but paired with the rest...), then never returned to refill our glasses when they were empty.  In fact, the next time we saw her after our food was deposited was when we hunted her down for the bill.  Even then she didn't clear our dishes and instead opted to do so once she brought our change and we were in the process of leaving, which felt weird and almost as though we were being guilted into leaving a greater tip.   I think I've given Browns enough chances.  There are plenty of half decent places to get food on George St, no point in returning to one which can't even deliver the half.

43IaCbEFuzdQeO5wwmCXZg.text: It was a weekend evening during festival time = probably no surprise that the service was slow. A long wait to order, a longer one for the bill and the wait staff generally looked overstretched and rushed off their feet.  Luckily we'd come with patience, being grateful just to have found somewhere convenient that wasn't fully booked! We had to wait 30mins in the bar first which was fine to get started on cocktails, and I liked that they give you one of those flashing vibrating things to call you when your table's ready. Minimal fuss!  The barman was also a little slow and had to look up some of our cocktails but my Secret Garden was worth waiting for. I did have to siphon off a bunch of ice though as the barman seemed to think the finishing touch for all of them should be to pile it up on top of the glass. Fail. Also skip the You Rang M'Lord - my sister claimed it was delish, but it really wasn't :P  Once at the table the annoying thing about waiting to order was that two separate waiters told us they'd be with us 'in one minute' but ten mins later we were still waiting. They may need some tips on managing expectations - I'd prefer they said nothing if they weren't coming back!  Our eventual waitress turned out to be very sweet and we couldn't hold it against her. The mood was also saved by the food: gorgeously gooey baked camembert sharer with dunkable bread first, followed by fish and chips for me - lightly battered and served with fat chips and a yum pea puree. My sisters were also happy with their chicken (with potato rosti and veg), and lamb, mint and feta burger (with skinny fries).  The menu was huge and varied though and overall this is reliable, crowd-pleasing food in a grand old brasserie-style setting. A good fallback to take the family for a nice meal out if you're not inspired by (or can't get a table) anywhere else on George St.

U02oht22cBEFM4rOyNDRrA.text: I live around the corner from browns and often look for a place to do a bit of work on the laptop, have some breakfast and a coffee.  Browns has been amazing on my last few visits. I particularly like the simple scrambled eggs, toast and smoked salmon. The coffee is well made and not your atypical restaurant coffee.  Evidently I am not the only one, often see people doing the same or having a morning meeting over breakfast.  The service is friendly and attentive (especially for someone who'll come in for a breakfast and linger for a couple of hours!).  So if you're looking for a place for a breakfast meeting, or just need a space to send some emails over some tasty food, Browns is a great bet.

jpi3bn8vAoRLwjuVdyUAMw.text: Not impressed with the food, ok service, good drinks.  Hubs ordered the surf and turf which was the tiniest lobsters tail and bite of steak I've ever seen.  I believe I had a burger.  3 stars because their cocktails were very yummy.  I believe they have nice specials on the cocktails during the week.  I'd return for the drinks but not the food.

aylpvgZnFgWNb24QA4o4Cg.text: Hadn't been for ages and we were on George Street on Friday night when I took a notion for some comfort food to warm us up - any excuse to get out of the freezing cold on Friday night.   We popped into Browns, it wasn't too busy at 7pm on Friday which was a nice surprise and meant that the service was superquick - the food arrived before our drinks! I had the steak and guiness pie with mash and the boy had a pasta dish.  Both were lovely and we shared a nice bottle of red. The icing was definitely the chocolate brownies for desert. Huge and delicious.  We shared two - one dark chocolate and the white chocolate and raspberry one. I will definitely go back.

ZB9qyzYa_Vwcg5sPySD55w.text: Yum yum yum yum.  Browns is a gastropub, so obviously most of the menu is a bit over-priced, but I hardly care because it's so good. The servings are a bit on the modest side, which is perfect for me but might put off a more grizzly bear-esque appetite. I always get the lobster dishes and my partner always gets steak. Both are perfect every time. The lobster pasta is ridiculously delicious, and much to my pleasant surprise, not stingy on the lobster. The lobster salad sandwich is also amazing, with just the right balance of a generous heaping of lobster, crunchy veg, and crispy bread which holds the sandwich together well but doesn't overpower the other ingredients.  The steak is always cooked perfectly, and the sides are fab as well. The cocktail menu is creative and really tasty (though the sweeter cocktails are quite sweet, so if sugary alcohol isn't your thing you might want to ask them to go light on the more sugary ingredients). The service is always friendly and attentive, and more easy-going than the posh interior of the place would lead you to expect. There's occasionally live piano music coming from the back of the restaurant - pleasant but not enough to drown out your conversation.  Browns is one of our very favourite date night spots, and it's probably a good thing for our budget that we don't live too near it.

LUNJLmGCup6gzbNBi9nREw.text: A classic of George Street, Browns is one of my favourite meeting points not only because its food, drinks and service are always consistently good or above but also because many of my friends have children and they can accommodate them no problem. As usual the front of house was welcoming, even though the place at lunchtime was rather busy. As I was having a business lunch I got the Fish & Chips (cod) with pea and mint puree, tartar sauce & chunky chips. The two pieces of cod were very tasty and the lightly battered coat was perfectly crispy, a real delight. Chips and tartar sauce passed the test too. Thanks to the strong O2 WiFi I was able to complete some reports in-situ, and after that the very well deserved pint(s) of Amstel lager to wash down the whole lot. Even though food prices range from average to the upper side, alcoholic drinks are, as expected in George Street, rather expensive.  The service was good, professional and efficient as always. Will certainly go back, keep up the good work!

photos.caption: Photo of Browns- Edinburgh - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Browns- Edinburgh - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Browns- Edinburgh - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

rkBKfKfbFNei5UGK8X3aRg.text: This is a fabulous choice for cocktails. I came here with a group of hens for a friend's weekend and was pretty bowled over by the drinks on offer. On Sundays they offer their signature cocktails for 5 in the afternoon, which is a seriously good deal considering the quality of cocktails. There's also a guy playing the grand piano - nice!  We also had the afternoon tea and were duly presented with sandwiches, warm scones and cakes. For 7 a head it was good value, but the quantity of food is on the small side, so make sure to eat your lunch before popping along for your tea and cakes! My mistake was in not eating before arriving.   To plug the gap I had some chips - they were amazing! The best chips I've had for ages and ages. They came wrapped up like a chip shop poke and were so tasty I would have happily ordered another plate. Yum!
